value.text: was the most important time for me

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 2
YES, both translations are close in quality and it was hard to choose between them.

text:
T1 is more coherent and better style-wise, though it makes a significant error at the beginning of the text.
T2 is very mediocre in comparison, but it got most of the text correctly, only the part "I ran all the way to the gate, and saw him standing outside smoking a cigarette from a distance through the iron railing." can be a bit confusing.
Overall, both translations aren't the best.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 一九九三年的那个冬天，对我来说最重要的事，是我爸爸回来了，就在我妈结婚前的那个星期。十二月的一个下午，他到学校来找我。我一路飞奔向大门口，隔着铁栏杆远远地看到他站在外面抽烟。身上穿着一件黑色长风衣，竖起的领子遮住了半张脸。不知道为什么，连他的样子也没有看清，就觉得他过得似乎很不好。我的心一酸，眼泪掉了出来。
data.target: The most significant event of winter 1993, as far as I was concerned, was Dad’s return—the week before Mom’s marriage. One afternoon in December, he showed up at my school and asked for me. I ran all the way to the gate. He was smoking some distance away on the other side of the metal fence, in a long black coat whose upturned collar hid half his face. Even before I could get a proper look at him, I had a feeling he wasn’t doing well. I felt a twinge in my heart, and tears came to my eyes.
data.text1: The winter of 1993 was the most important time for me, because my father had returned. It was the week before my mother’s wedding. One afternoon in December, he came to my school to find me. I ran all the way to the school gates, and from behind the iron bars, I could see him standing outside, smoking. He was wearing a black long coat, and the upturned collar was covering half of his face. I don’t know why, but even without seeing his face clearly, I could tell that he wasn’t doing well. My heart ached, and tears started to fall.
data.text2: The most important event for me in that winter of 1993 was my father's return, the week before my mother's wedding. One afternoon in December, he came to see me at school. I ran all the way to the gate, and saw him standing outside smoking a cigarette from a distance through the iron railing. He was wearing a long black windbreaker, with the raised collar covering half of his face. I don't know why, I didn't even see his appearance clearly, but I felt that he seemed to be having a bad time. My heart was sour, and tears fell out.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

The winter of 1993 was the most important time for me, because my father had returned. It was the week before my mother’s wedding. One afternoon in December, he came to my school to find me. I ran all the way to the school gates, and from behind the iron bars, I could see him standing outside, smoking. He was wearing a black long coat, and the upturned collar was covering half of his face. I don’t know why, but even without seeing his face clearly, I could tell that he wasn’t doing well. My heart ached, and tears started to fall.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

The most important event for me in that winter of 1993 was my father's return, the week before my mother's wedding. One afternoon in December, he came to see me at school. I ran all the way to the gate, and saw him standing outside smoking a cigarette from a distance through the iron railing. He was wearing a long black windbreaker, with the raised collar covering half of his face. I don't know why, I didn't even see his appearance clearly, but I felt that he seemed to be having a bad time. My heart was sour, and tears fell out.

text:
T1 is well-translated and good style-wise.
T2 is also good style-wise, but it has interpreted a rhetorical phrase as an affirmative one changing slightly the meaning of the original text ("perhaps" is missing from "perhaps deep down")

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我没想过我妈妈会有再婚的念头。或许潜意识里，我觉得她应该因为我爸爸的离开而一直痛苦下去，就像我一样。况且，我觉得她缺少那种找到幸福的能力。事实也许的确如此，可是幸福有能力找到她。不是吗，作为一个美人，根本不必那么辛苦，她什么都不用做，只要站在原地就好了。
data.target: I’d never imagined Mom would want to marry again. Perhaps subconsciously, I wanted her to keep suffering from Dad’s departure, just like I was. Besides, I felt she lacked the ability to find happiness—but it turned out happiness was still able to find her. She was attractive enough that she didn’t need to make any special effort, just standing there sufficed.
data.text1: I never thought that my mother would have the idea of remarrying. Perhaps subconsciously, I felt that she should suffer because of my dad's departure, just like me. Besides, I think she lacks that ability to find happiness. That may be true, but happiness has the power to find her. Isn't it, as a beauty, it doesn't have to be so hard at all, she doesn't have to do anything, she just needs to stand where she is.
data.text2: I never thought that my mother would consider remarrying. Deep down, I felt that she should remain in pain and sorrow, just like me, due to my father’s departure. Besides, I felt that she lacked the ability to find happiness. Perhaps that was true, but happiness had the ability to find her. After all, as a beautiful woman, she didn’t have to work so hard. She didn’t have to do anything—she just had to stand still.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

I never thought that my mother would have the idea of remarrying. Perhaps subconsciously, I felt that she should suffer because of my dad's departure, just like me. Besides, I think she lacks that ability to find happiness. That may be true, but happiness has the power to find her. Isn't it, as a beauty, it doesn't have to be so hard at all, she doesn't have to do anything, she just needs to stand where she is.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

I never thought that my mother would consider remarrying. Deep down, I felt that she should remain in pain and sorrow, just like me, due to my father’s departure. Besides, I felt that she lacked the ability to find happiness. Perhaps that was true, but happiness had the ability to find her. After all, as a beautiful woman, she didn’t have to work so hard. She didn’t have to do anything—she just had to stand still.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 2

text:
Both are good style-wise. The difference between the two is mostly how they translate nouns.
Despite the fact that both, the "winter jasmine" and "peach blossom", signify the upcoming spring, the former is the correct one. Hence, I chose T2.

choices: YES, both translations are close in quality and it was hard to choose between them.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我还记得，那一年的冬天特别长，四月过了一半，迎春花还没有开。父母离婚的事，令你的情绪很消沉。我们好久都没有什么新游戏了，一到傍晚就百无脚赖地坐在死人塔的房顶上。院子里散落的那些身体部件中，又多了几只胳膊。我们用钩子把它们拨到一起，摆成了一个千手观音。
data.target: That winter felt particularly long. Halfway through April, the first flowers hadn’t yet bloomed. You were feeling low because of your parents’ divorce. We’d stopped playing games. In the evenings, we sat on the wall around Dead Man’s Tower. There were now more dismembered arms among the body parts in the courtyard. We reached for them with a grappling hook, pulling them into the shape of a thousand-handed Goddess of Mercy.
data.text1: I still remember that the winter that year was particularly long. It was already halfway through April, and the peach blossoms still hadn’t bloomed. Your mood was very low due to your parents’ divorce. We hadn’t had any new games for a long time, so in the evenings we would just sit on the roof of the Dead Man’s Tower, with nothing to do. Among the body parts scattered around the courtyard, there were now a few extra arms. We hooked them together and arranged them into a statue of the Thousand-Armed Guanyin.
data.text2: I still remember that the winter of that year was very long, halfway through April, and the winter jasmine hadn't bloomed yet. The divorce of your parents has made you very depressed. We haven't had any new games for a long time, and we just sit helplessly on the roof of the Tower of the Dead in the evening. Among the body parts scattered in the yard, there were a few more arms. We used hooks to pull them together to form a thousand-armed Avalokitesvara.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

I still remember that the winter that year was particularly long. It was already halfway through April, and the peach blossoms still hadn’t bloomed. Your mood was very low due to your parents’ divorce. We hadn’t had any new games for a long time, so in the evenings we would just sit on the roof of the Dead Man’s Tower, with nothing to do. Among the body parts scattered around the courtyard, there were now a few extra arms. We hooked them together and arranged them into a statue of the Thousand-Armed Guanyin.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

I still remember that the winter of that year was very long, halfway through April, and the winter jasmine hadn't bloomed yet. The divorce of your parents has made you very depressed. We haven't had any new games for a long time, and we just sit helplessly on the roof of the Tower of the Dead in the evening. Among the body parts scattered in the yard, there were a few more arms. We used hooks to pull them together to form a thousand-armed Avalokitesvara.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 2

text:
Both translations are stylistically fine, but T1 translates parts of the source text word-for-word, which is a mistake I would expect from a machine translation. "This cousin is the eldest son of her family" in T1 is a bit hard to understand, it should be "her eldest son" but I guess that interpretation is possible.
T2 uses words like "refuge", "outcast", which are bit dramatic compared to the source text, but overall acceptable.

choices: NO, the translations I have chosen is visibly better.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我爸爸其实对做生意一窍不通，只是去投奔一个并不相熟的表哥。我奶奶有个妹妹，早年去了北京，后来在那里结婚生子。这个表哥是她家的长子，在整个家族里，一直作为一个异类存在。
data.target: Dad didn’t actually know anything about business—he was just throwing his lot in with a cousin he didn’t even know that well. Grandma’s little sister had moved to Beijing early on, got married and had kids there. This cousin of Dad’s was her eldest son, and he didn’t fit into our clan at all.
data.text1: My father actually knew nothing about business, he just went to join a cousin he didn't know well. My grandma has a younger sister who went to Beijing in her early years and later got married and had children there. This cousin is the eldest son of her family, and has always existed as a different kind in the whole family.
data.text2: My father, in fact, had no idea how to do business, but he had gone to seek refuge with a distant cousin. My grandmother had a younger sister who had gone to Beijing in her youth, and had gotten married and had children there. This cousin was her eldest son, and had always been an outcast in the family.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

My father actually knew nothing about business, he just went to join a cousin he didn't know well. My grandma has a younger sister who went to Beijing in her early years and later got married and had children there. This cousin is the eldest son of her family, and has always existed as a different kind in the whole family.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

My father, in fact, had no idea how to do business, but he had gone to seek refuge with a distant cousin. My grandmother had a younger sister who had gone to Beijing in her youth, and had gotten married and had children there. This cousin was her eldest son, and had always been an outcast in the family.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 1

text:
T1 is much better style-wise.
"起运" is a tricky word to translate without any context. "start their journey" and "start luck", technically both translations' can be considered correct. I prefer the version in T1 as "start your journey" is less likely to cause any confusion and is a more likely translation in this context.

choices: NO, the translations I have chosen is visibly better.

value.text: I have never had a home.
Mine should be around eight years old.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 刚才你说每个人都有一个起运的时间，人生好像忽然套上了缰绳。我的应该是在八岁。那年秋天，爸爸离开济南，一个人去了北京。从那以后，我就再也没有家了。
data.target: Earlier on, you said everyone has a moment when their fate is activated, and after that they’re being led around by a rope. For me, that probably happened when I turned eight. Dad left Jinan in the fall and traveled alone to Beijing. From then on, I had no home.
data.text1: Just now you said that everyone has a time when they start their journey, as if their life has suddenly been put on a leash. Mine was when I was eight. That autumn, my father left Jinan and went to Beijing by himself. From then on, I no longer had a home.
data.text2: Just now you said that everyone has a time to start luck, and life seems to be put on the reins suddenly. Mine should be around eight years old. That autumn, my father left Jinan and went to Beijing alone. Since then, I have never had a home.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

Just now you said that everyone has a time when they start their journey, as if their life has suddenly been put on a leash. Mine was when I was eight. That autumn, my father left Jinan and went to Beijing by himself. From then on, I no longer had a home.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

Just now you said that everyone has a time to start luck, and life seems to be put on the reins suddenly. Mine should be around eight years old. That autumn, my father left Jinan and went to Beijing alone. Since then, I have never had a home.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text

text:
T1 is well-translated and overall good style-wise.
T2 used "make an appointment" while from the source text it is clear that the appointment was already made but the person does not plan to show up. Overall, T2's writing is more problematic, e.g., "one by one" (smoking cigarettes).

choices: NO, the translations I have chosen is visibly better.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我并不打算赴约。不管是因为什么，我想我们都没有再见面的必要了。我坐在沙发上一支一支地抽烟，天色越来越暗，门突然笃笃地敲响了。送水的男孩扛着水桶站在门囗，说是给西郊的一户人家送水去了。他戴着一顶脏兮兮的灰色毛线帽子，神情恍惚。
data.target:
I hadn’t planned to show up—I didn’t think we had any need to meet again. I sat on the couch and smoked cigarette after cigarette as it got dark. Then someone tapped on the door: the water delivery boy. He wore a filthy gray wool hat and looked harried.
“I had to make a delivery on the west side,” he said.
data.text1: I had no intention of keeping the appointment. For whatever reason, I felt that there was no longer any need for us to meet. I was sitting on the sofa, smoking one cigarette after another, when the sky gradually darkened. Suddenly, there was a knock at the door. The water delivery boy was standing outside, carrying a bucket of water, saying he was delivering it to a family in the western suburbs. He wore a dirty gray woolen hat, and his expression was dazed.
data.text2: I'm not going to make an appointment. No matter what the reason is, I don't think there is any need for us to meet again. I sat on the sofa and smoked cigarettes one by one. It was getting darker and darker, and there was a sudden knock on the door. The water delivery boy was standing at the door with a bucket on his shoulders, saying that he was delivering water to a family in the western suburbs. He wore a dirty gray woolen hat and looked dazed.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

I had no intention of keeping the appointment. For whatever reason, I felt that there was no longer any need for us to meet. I was sitting on the sofa, smoking one cigarette after another, when the sky gradually darkened. Suddenly, there was a knock at the door. The water delivery boy was standing outside, carrying a bucket of water, saying he was delivering it to a family in the western suburbs. He wore a dirty gray woolen hat, and his expression was dazed.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

I'm not going to make an appointment. No matter what the reason is, I don't think there is any need for us to meet again. I sat on the sofa and smoked cigarettes one by one. It was getting darker and darker, and there was a sudden knock on the door. The water delivery boy was standing at the door with a bucket on his shoulders, saying that he was delivering water to a family in the western suburbs. He wore a dirty gray woolen hat and looked dazed.

text:
T2 is well-translated and good style-wise with two relatively minor issues.
T1 mixed up past and present tense and misinterpreted the subject of the second sentence. It also translates "the doorway of the building" as a "cave" which is rather unfortunate.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我们的谈话进行得很艰难。每次陷入沉默，我都觉得心脏受到压迫，只想快点结束这次见面。你似乎有所察觉，但还在努力寻找话题。茶冷下去，屋子里的白雾已经散尽，你终于起身告辞。我刚关上门，感觉松了一囗气，门铃又响了。你站在门囗，请我晚些到小白楼来。我还没有来得及推辞，你已经走出了楼洞。
data.target: It was a difficult conversation. Every time we fell into silence, I felt something squeezing at my heart, and I wanted to end this encounter as quickly as possible. You seemed to sense this, and searched for something else to talk about. The tea cooled, the fog dissipated. You stood to leave. I’d only just closed the door and sighed in relief when the bell rang again. You said I should come to the white mansion later and walked away before I could respond.
data.text1: Our conversation was difficult. Every time I fall into silence, I feel that my heart is being oppressed, and I just want to end this meeting quickly. You seem to be aware of it, but are still trying to find something to talk about. The tea is cold, the white mist in the room has cleared, and you finally get up to say goodbye. I just closed the door, feeling relieved, when the doorbell rang again. You stand at the door and invite me to come to Xiaobailou later. I haven't had time to refuse, you have already walked out of the cave.
data.text2: Our conversation was very difficult. Every time we fell into a silence, I felt my heart being compressed, and I just wanted to end the meeting as soon as possible. You seemed to have noticed, but still kept trying to find a topic of conversation. The tea had cooled down, and the white mist in the room had dispersed. Finally, you stood up to leave. Just as I closed the door, I felt a sense of relief. But then the doorbell rang again. You were standing outside the door, asking me to come to Little White Tower later. Before I had a chance to refuse, you had already walked out of the doorway.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

Our conversation was difficult. Every time I fall into silence, I feel that my heart is being oppressed, and I just want to end this meeting quickly. You seem to be aware of it, but are still trying to find something to talk about. The tea is cold, the white mist in the room has cleared, and you finally get up to say goodbye. I just closed the door, feeling relieved, when the doorbell rang again. You stand at the door and invite me to come to Xiaobailou later. I haven't had time to refuse, you have already walked out of the cave.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

Our conversation was very difficult. Every time we fell into a silence, I felt my heart being compressed, and I just wanted to end the meeting as soon as possible. You seemed to have noticed, but still kept trying to find a topic of conversation. The tea had cooled down, and the white mist in the room had dispersed. Finally, you stood up to leave. Just as I closed the door, I felt a sense of relief. But then the doorbell rang again. You were standing outside the door, asking me to come to Little White Tower later. Before I had a chance to refuse, you had already walked out of the doorway.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 2

text:
T1 contains numerous errors, making the entire passage confusing for the reader who is unlikely to understand author's intended message.
T2 used "Half a pot of water", instead of "Half of the pot of water" which is closer to the original meaning. Overall, T2 is much better than T1.

choices: NO, the translations I have chosen is visibly better.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source:
我走到厨房关掉炉子。水已经蒸发了半壶，整个房间弥漫在白雾里。你局促地坐下来，看着我倒茶。
"你还跟奶奶和姑姑一起住吗？“你问。
我告诉你，奶奶已经去世了，现在我和姑姑一起生活。
"她一直没成家“　你问。
"嗯。“
data.target:
I went to the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half the water had boiled away, filling the room with fog. You sat and watched anxiously as I made tea.
“Are you still living with your grandma and aunt?” you asked.
I told you Granny was dead, but yes, I was still with Auntie.
“And she never married?”
“No.”
data.text1:
I went to the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half of the pot of water has evaporated, and the whole room is filled with white mist. You sit down awkwardly and watch me pour tea.
"Do you still live with your grandma and aunt?" you ask.
Let me tell you, grandma has passed away, and now I live with my aunt.
"She never had a family" you ask.
"Ok."
data.text2:
I walked into the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half a pot of water had already evaporated, and the entire room was filled with white mist. You sat down awkwardly and watched me pour the tea.
"Do you still live with your grandmother and aunt?" you asked.
I told you that my grandmother had already passed away, and that I was now living with my aunt.
"She never got married?" you asked.
"No," I replied.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

I went to the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half of the pot of water has evaporated, and the whole room is filled with white mist. You sit down awkwardly and watch me pour tea.
"Do you still live with your grandma and aunt?" you ask.
Let me tell you, grandma has passed away, and now I live with my aunt.
"She never had a family" you ask.
"Ok."


########


TRANSLATION 2:

I walked into the kitchen and turned off the stove. Half a pot of water had already evaporated, and the entire room was filled with white mist. You sat down awkwardly and watched me pour the tea.
"Do you still live with your grandmother and aunt?" you asked.
I told you that my grandmother had already passed away, and that I was now living with my aunt.
"She never got married?" you asked.
"No," I replied.

choices: NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
TRANSLATION 2

text:
Aside from the obvious mistakes, T1 has managed to include the " 'It's just that' the little peachy face is dark and sad, with an expression of staying in the big city for a long time." in its translation from the source, which T2 failed to do.
T2 in comparison is more of the mediocre side in the writing department. It's a close call, but I eventually went for T2 since it didn't make the reckless mistakes like T1 did.

choices: YES, both translations are close in quality and it was hard to choose between them.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 你嘴巴里呼出的白色哈气，被风撩起的卷曲头发，大衣下摆底下微微颤动的膝盖，这些让我相信眼前的你是真实的存在，并非是先前那个梦的延续。十八年没见了，认不出来也不奇怪。你没有化妆，苍白的脸有一点浮肿，不过总算没有辜负大家的期望，长成了一个美人。只是那张桃心小脸乌戚戚的，一副在大都市待久了的神情。你问我，你的样子是不是和我想象的不一样。我不置可否地笑了笑。坦白说，我从未想象过你长大之后的样子。对我而言，和你有关的一切都已经装进档案袋，封上了火漆。说出来或许会有些伤人吧，不过，我真的没有期待与你再见面。
data.target: Your breath came white from your mouth. The wind had tangled your curly hair, and your knees were trembling under your coat. All these things told me you were actually there, and this wasn’t just a continuation of the dream. I hadn’t seen you in eighteen years, no wonder I couldn’t recognize you. You weren’t wearing makeup, and your pale face looked a little swollen, but it was clear you’d grown into a beauty like we’d all known you would—though you had the numb expression of someone who’s been in the big city too long. You asked if you looked how I’d imagined. I smiled and admitted I’d never imagined you grown up. As far as I was concerned, you and everything to do with you had been placed into a sealed folder. Maybe this is hurtful to hear, but I had truly never hoped to meet you again.
data.text1: The white breath out of your mouth, the curly hair lifted by the wind, the slightly trembling knees under the hem of the coat, all these make me believe that the you in front of me is a real existence, not a continuation of the previous dream. I haven't seen her for eighteen years, so it's not surprising that I don't recognize her. You don't have any makeup on, your pale face is a little swollen, but you have finally lived up to everyone's expectations, and you have grown into a beauty. It's just that the little peachy face is dark and sad, with an expression of staying in the big city for a long time. You ask me if your appearance is different from what I imagined. I smiled noncommittally. Frankly, I never imagined what you would look like when you grew up. To me, everything about you is in the portfolio and sealed. It might hurt to say it, but I really don't look forward to seeing you again.
data.text2: The white breath that came out of your mouth, the curls of your hair that were being blown by the wind, and the slight trembling of your knees beneath the hem of your coat—all of these made me believe that you were a real person, and not just a continuation of the dream I had before. It was no surprise that I couldn’t recognize you after not seeing you for eighteen years. You weren’t wearing any makeup, and your pale face was a little swollen, but you had still managed to live up to everyone’s expectations and become a beautiful woman. Your peach-shaped face was a little gloomy, and you had the look of someone who had been in the city for a long time. You asked me if you looked different from what I had imagined. I just smiled without answering. To be honest, I had never imagined what you would look like when you grew up. Everything related to you had already been sealed away in a file folder, and the glue was dry. It might hurt to say this, but I had never expected to see you again.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

The white breath out of your mouth, the curly hair lifted by the wind, the slightly trembling knees under the hem of the coat, all these make me believe that the you in front of me is a real existence, not a continuation of the previous dream. I haven't seen her for eighteen years, so it's not surprising that I don't recognize her. You don't have any makeup on, your pale face is a little swollen, but you have finally lived up to everyone's expectations, and you have grown into a beauty. It's just that the little peachy face is dark and sad, with an expression of staying in the big city for a long time. You ask me if your appearance is different from what I imagined. I smiled noncommittally. Frankly, I never imagined what you would look like when you grew up. To me, everything about you is in the portfolio and sealed. It might hurt to say it, but I really don't look forward to seeing you again.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

The white breath that came out of your mouth, the curls of your hair that were being blown by the wind, and the slight trembling of your knees beneath the hem of your coat—all of these made me believe that you were a real person, and not just a continuation of the dream I had before. It was no surprise that I couldn’t recognize you after not seeing you for eighteen years. You weren’t wearing any makeup, and your pale face was a little swollen, but you had still managed to live up to everyone’s expectations and become a beautiful woman. Your peach-shaped face was a little gloomy, and you had the look of someone who had been in the city for a long time. You asked me if you looked different from what I had imagined. I just smiled without answering. To be honest, I had never imagined what you would look like when you grew up. Everything related to you had already been sealed away in a file folder, and the glue was dry. It might hurt to say this, but I had never expected to see you again.

choices: TRANSLATION 1
NEITHER of the translations add or omit information that significantly change the meaning of the text
NO, the translations I have chosen is visibly better.

text:
Despite the fact T2 didn't add or omit anything, it has lots of grammar mistakes at the very beginning (here classified as mistranslations as they stem from misinterpreting the source as a whole). The writing in T2 not only feels as if it was machine-translated, but also is very rough in general. 
T1 is well-translated, with only one simple grammar mistake.

data.author: zhang_yueran
data.source: 我睁开眼睛。你站在门囗。我不知道你已经站了多久，没准连我在梦里大笑都看到了。还有醒来的悲伤，最虚弱时刻的样子。程恭，你低声喊出我的名字，声音非常沙哑，似乎已经很久没有开囗讲过话。快要下雪了，天阴得厉害，屋子里黑漆漆的。炉子上的水沸了，咕嚕噜地翻滚着。我仔细地看了你一会儿，确信自己并不认识你。可是在昏暗的光线里，我忽然觉得这个站在对面的陌生人，似乎与我的生命有很深的联结。那种感觉让人背后一阵发凉。我努力回想着，记忆的卡片在头脑中晔啦晔啦地翻动。然后你说，你是李佳栖。
data.target: I opened my eyes. You were in the doorway. I didn’t know how long you’d been there. Had you seen me laughing from the dream, then my sadness when I woke, when I was at my most vulnerable? You said my name in a soft, raspy voice, as if you hadn’t spoken for a long time. The sky was dark—about to snow. The boiling water rumbled. I looked carefully but didn’t know who you were, yet I felt this stranger standing in the gloom had a deep connection to my life. The thought chilled my spine. I frantically flicked through the Rolodex of my mind. You told me you were Li Jiaqi.
data.text1: I opened my eyes, and there you were, standing in the doorway. I don’t know how long you had been standing there, maybe you even saw me laughing in my dream. And the sadness of waking up, the look of my weakest moment. Cheng Gong, you called my name in a low, hoarse voice, as if you hadn’t spoken in a long time. It was about to snow, and the sky was very dark. The room was pitch black. The water in the stove was boiling, bubbling and rolling. I looked at you for a while, to make sure I didn’t recognize you. But in the dim light, I suddenly felt that this stranger standing across from me was somehow deeply connected to my life. I felt a chill down my spine. I tried to remember, and the cards of memory flipped through my mind. Then you said, you were Li Jiaqi.
data.text2: I open my eyes. You stand at the door. I don't know how long you've been standing there, maybe you even saw me laughing in my dream. And the sadness of waking up, the look of the weakest moment. Cheng Gong, you called out my name in a low voice, your voice was very hoarse, it seemed that you hadn't spoken for a long time. It was about to snow, the sky was very cloudy, and the house was dark. The water on the stove was boiling and tumbling. I looked at you carefully for a while, and was sure I didn't know you. But in the dim light, I suddenly felt that this stranger standing opposite seemed to have a deep connection with my life. That feeling sent chills down the back. I tried hard to recall, and the memory cards flipped in my mind. Then you said, you are Li Jiaqi.
data.merged:
TRANSLATION 1:

I opened my eyes, and there you were, standing in the doorway. I don’t know how long you had been standing there, maybe you even saw me laughing in my dream. And the sadness of waking up, the look of my weakest moment. Cheng Gong, you called my name in a low, hoarse voice, as if you hadn’t spoken in a long time. It was about to snow, and the sky was very dark. The room was pitch black. The water in the stove was boiling, bubbling and rolling. I looked at you for a while, to make sure I didn’t recognize you. But in the dim light, I suddenly felt that this stranger standing across from me was somehow deeply connected to my life. I felt a chill down my spine. I tried to remember, and the cards of memory flipped through my mind. Then you said, you were Li Jiaqi.


########


TRANSLATION 2:

I open my eyes. You stand at the door. I don't know how long you've been standing there, maybe you even saw me laughing in my dream. And the sadness of waking up, the look of the weakest moment. Cheng Gong, you called out my name in a low voice, your voice was very hoarse, it seemed that you hadn't spoken for a long time. It was about to snow, the sky was very cloudy, and the house was dark. The water on the stove was boiling and tumbling. I looked at you carefully for a while, and was sure I didn't know you. But in the dim light, I suddenly felt that this stranger standing opposite seemed to have a deep connection with my life. That feeling sent chills down the back. I tried hard to recall, and the memory cards flipped in my mind. Then you said, you are Li Jiaqi.
